Dear Dr. Paris Miller:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 11/09/2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CCI Rule 400.4127 Staff to resident ratio
(4) When residents are asleep or otherwise
outside of the direct supervision of staff, staff
shall perform variable interval, eye-on checks of
residents. The time between the variable interval
checks shall not exceed fifteen minutes.
Room monitoring sheets are prefilled with prompts in 15-minute intervals, which
makes the eye-on check not a variable check.

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
CCI Rule 400.4506 Fire drills and telephone
Written records shall be maintained for each quarterly emergency fire drill
indicating the date and time of the drill and where evacuation was a part of the
drill, the approximate evacuation time. The drills shall be conducted at different
times of the day and night. Two of the drills shall include evacuations unless
approved by the department, in writing, as clinically contraindicated.
CCI Rule 400.4524 Fire detection; large facilities
Fire detection systems in existing licensed facilities shall be maintained in proper
working order and shall be tested at least quarterly, with a written record
maintained of the testing.
CCI Rule 400.4552 Heating devices and flame producing devices
A copy of the annual furnace inspection completed by a licensed inspector must
be made available to the qualified fire inspector or the department’s licensing
authority upon request.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
Havenwyck Impulse Disorder Program has one incident of maltreatment in care
during this inspection period. Staff 1, Staff 2, and Supervisor 2 facilitated a prone
restraint of Youth A. Nurse Manager, Supervisor 3, and Clinician were present and
did not intervene. The facility did not follow their policy and procedure in
documenting 5-minute checks on Youth A during the restraint, did not complete
the documentation for 15-minutes checks (form was not completed), did not
complete the physical assessment within 1-hour after the restraint, and did not
replace medication removed from the emergency injectable box, causing a delay
in Youth A receiving an injection during the restraint.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
Havenwyck Impulse Disorder Program has 4 approved corrective action plans
during this licensing period.

• 01/2023 Interim Inspection cited R 400.4166 (1)(f) Discharge Plan , R
400.4146 Immunizations (1), R 400.4128 (4)(h) Initial staff orientation
and ongoing staff training, and RFCAN DHHS report forms. Facility is in
full compliance with their interim inspection corrective action plan as
none of the citations were found as repeat citations during this renewal
inspection.
• 2023C0000196 cited R 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff. Staff did not
provide for the continual needs, protection, and supervision of Youth A
and Youth B when they were allowed to sit in separate desks side-by-
side and sexually acted out. Facility is in full compliance with this
corrective action plan with the retraining of staff and monitoring of where
youths are permitted to sit during leisure time in the classroom.
• 2023C0000655 cited R 400.4109 (1)(c) Program statement, R 400.4159
(2)(e) Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention; prohibited
restraints; elimination of restraints, and R 400.4112 (4)(a) Criminal
history check subject to requirements; staff qualifications. Facility is
currently monitored for corrective action plan compliance. Facility
implemented quarterly drills focusing on preventing and rotating out of
prone position restraints in addition to twice a year training in Nonviolent
Crisis Prevention Intervention. Restraint videos are reviewed within a
day of the incident and followed up as needed. Staff were retrained and
will review quarterly the requirement of restraint checks at 5 minutes and
15 minutes and nursing assessment within 1-hour after a restraint.
Emergency box replenishment was covered with nursing staff in training.
• 2023C0000714 cited R 400.4158 (1)(a) Intervention standards and
prohibitions. Staff Person 1’s loud, harsh tone was not supportive in
nature to the youths. Facility is currently monitored for corrective action
plan compliance. Facility discusses appropriate verbal tone in bi-weekly
team meetings and will retrain staff as needed. Youths complete
monthly surveys reflecting staff performance and the surveys are
reviewed for staff recognition and areas for improvement.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns based on the review of Universal Health Services
2022 annual report.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
This is not applicable.

Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief administrator report signed and dated 11/06/2023 was reviewed. Chief
Administrator Assessment report states there were no unplanned discharges
during this inspection period. It states Department of Child Welfare Licensing
approved corrective action plans are implemented and being worked on for
compliance.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff were interviewed on November 8, 2023. Staff did not report concerns or
training needs.
Youths were interviewed on November 8, 2023. Youths reported feeling safe and
did not report concerns.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency was neat and orderly on November 8, 2023. No concerns outside of
the ones cited by Qualified Fire Inspector.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
